intro: Astragalus cobresiiphilus, commonly known as the Sierra Madre milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Astragalus cobresiiphilus is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
